page.title: 09RELIGION.
page.content: There are several places of worship in the vicinity. In Burnopfield itself there is St.James'Parish Church which is Church of England,a Gospel Fellowship Hall and Haswell Methodist Chapel.In nearby Byermoor there is a Roman Catholic Church and in Tanfield Village is St. Margaret's which is also Church of England. Originally the Parish was contained within the Parish of Tanfield.it was in 1872 that the Parish of Burnopfield was separated from Tanfield and it appears that in 1873 the church of St.James was largely completed. A march is held each year on St.George's Day from St.James'Church Hall to the War Memorial.The Cubs,Brownies,Scouts,Guides and Boy's Brigade form a large part of the parade.
